flawed_nl_solution:
The total ratio representing the 500 cards is 11+9 = <<11+9=15>>15
The fraction of the total ratio that represents the number of cards that Ellis got is 11/15, and since there were 500 cards, Ellis got 11/15*500 = <<11/15*500=1100/3>>1100/3
If there were 500 cards, and Ellis received 1100/3 cards, Orion received 500-1100/3 = <<500-1100/3=400/3>>400/3 cards
The number of cards that Ellis received more than Orion is 1100/3-400/3 = <<1100/3-400/3=700/3>>700/3 cards.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 15. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
